vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require

vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
ProPoolLib.addressTransfer (ProPool.sol#1469-1475) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- destination.transfer(etherAmount) (ProPool.sol#1474)

vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
ProPoolLib.addressCall (ProPool.sol#1487-1500) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- require(bool)(destination.call.gas(gasAmount).value(etherAmount)(data)) (ProPool.sol#1494-1499)
	- require(bool)(destination.call.gas(gasleft()()).value(etherAmount)(data)) (ProPool.sol#1494-1499)

vulnerability_findings.message: sumRemaining in ProPoolLib.withdrawAllRemaining2 (ProPool.sol#1072) is a local variable never initialiazed

vulnerability_findings.name: uninitialized-local
vulnerability_findings.message: amount in ProPoolLib.withdrawAllContribution (ProPool.sol#967) is a local variable never initialiazed

vulnerability_findings.name: uninitialized-local
vulnerability_findings.message: amount in ProPoolLib.withdrawAllRemaining1 (ProPool.sol#1022) is a local variable never initialiazed

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: uint share = calcShare(self, addr, currentAmount, fraction);
vulnerability_findings.message:
QuotaLib.claimShare.share (local variable @ ProPool.sol#155) shadows:
	- QuotaLib.share (function @ ProPool.sol#186-188)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
ProPoolLib.getPoolDetails2 has external calls inside a loop:
	- tokenBalances[i] = IERC20Base(tokenAddresses[i]).balanceOf(address(this)) (ProPool.sol#848)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
ProPoolLib.getParticipantShares has external calls inside a loop:
	- tokenShare[i] = pool.tokenQuota[pool.tokenAddresses[i]].calcShare(addr,IERC20Base(pool.tokenAddresses[i]).balanceOf(address(this)),(netPartContribution,netPoolContribution)) (ProPool.sol#912-916)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
ProPoolLib.withdrawTokens has external calls inside a loop:
	- tokenBalance = tokenContract.balanceOf(address(this)) (ProPool.sol#1212)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
ProPoolLib.withdrawTokens has external calls inside a loop:
	- succeeded = tokenContract.transfer(msg.sender,tokenAmount) (ProPool.sol#1225)

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function getGroupDetails(Pool storage pool, uint idx)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values).
Classification: SWC-110
